fields.description:
When user is assigned to project in some role and user types username himself, this leads undeletable association. 

If we have user with username *test* and we associate her by typing _test_ to "Add user(s) to project role" text box association is created and can be deleted. But if I type _Test_ I can create an association that cannot be deleted - nothing happens if I try to delete user.

SQL Server itself is configured to case-insensitivity and query to projectroleactor table returns role mappings in a form they were typed (some as 'test' and some as 'Test').
fields.summary: Assign Users to Project Role handles case sensitivity in username wrong - association that cannot be deleted

fields.description:
If you go to http://jira.atlassian.com/500page.jsp, you'll see detailed config info for services and listeners, eg:

 - Sales Issue POP Service (com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService)
   - Delay: 10 minutes
   - handler: Create Or Comment Handler
   - popserver: sales-issues @ atlassian.com
   - handler.params: project=SALES, issuetype=3
   - usessl: No SSL
   - forwardEmail: jeff@atlassian.com

As great as this is for support, it does reveal potentially sensitive details like project keys to anonymous users. Also, if people develop custom services or listeners that are configured with passwords, those should show up here too.

I think we should only display services/listeners data to people who are logged in as administrators.
fields.summary: On 500page.jsp, only show services info to admins

fields.description:
If you move an issue, you can view the issue with the new and old issue key (the later redirecting to the new key).
However this is not the case when you use the old issue key as part of an issue view url.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create an issue in one project, say, AAA-1
# Move it to another project. For example, it becomes BBB-2
# The new BBB-2 key works fine for issue views. Eg: <JIRA>[/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/BBB-2/BBB-2.xml|http://JIRA/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/BBB-2/BBB-2.xml]
# But the old AAA-1 key does not get redirected to the new key: BBB-2 Eg: <JIRA>[/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/AAA-1/AAA-1.xml|http://JIRA/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/AAA-1/AAA-1.xml]
fields.summary: Redirect issue views with old issue key

fields.description:
The [docs|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.7.3/bugzilla_import.html] state that JIRA supports importing from Bugzilla 2.16, 2.18 and 2.20. However, running it against v2.16.3 results in:

{code}
java.sql.SQLException: Column 'id' not found. 
at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:910) 
at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.findColumn(ResultSet.java:955) 
at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2570) 
at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.getAllBugzillaProjects(BugzillaImportBean.java:1642) 
...
{code}

The "id" column was introduced sometime after [2.16.3|http://www.ravenbrook.com/project/p4dti/tool/cgi/bugzilla-schema/index.cgi?action=single&version=2.16.3&view=View+schema#table-products] in [2.18|http://www.ravenbrook.com/project/p4dti/tool/cgi/bugzilla-schema/index.cgi?action=single&version=2.18&view=View+schema#table-products].

We need to amend the docs to correctly show which versions we do support, or fix the importer to be compatible with 2.16. Either way we should extend the bugzilla functional tests to include all supported versions - at the moment it only tests 2.20.
fields.summary: Bugzilla Importer doesn't support Bugzilla 2.16.x

When you choose to create a Word document from the issues, JIRA creates one Word table per issue. The tables created in the Word document no longer have their lines drawn out, ie the lines are now invisible (previously, the lines were black, thick lines)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12062].
  {panel}

There are quite a few things that should be configurable when viewing an issue navigator view.

For example, maximum number of issues to export (See discussions on JRA-8899), what columns to export, etc.

Some of these parameters would be different for each navigator view.

We should build an intermediary screen to ask the user for parameters before actually running the Navigator View as we do now.
fields.summary: Create an intermediary screen to query user for parameters for each Issue Navigator Views

fields.description: The edit of a project roles group membership should be guarded by the Browse Users global permission just like the user picker is for editing user project role membership. This issue is related to JRA-11884. To have the same behavior as the user picker we will need to change the UI to be like the User picker, with a Group chooser popup and the text input field that accepts comma delimited group names. We can then make it such that the picker does not show up when the user does not have the permission.
fields.summary: Guard project role group membership edits by the global permission Browse Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12059].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. 

There is a workaround, though, that might be used for the specific use case defined in the description. It involves JIRA Importers Plugin (or JIM for short), which is available for both Cloud and Server deployments of JIRA. JIM allows for issues to be imported from CSV format (also available for regular JIRA users - not only Admins) and JIM's wizard includes a step where user select the project he/she wants the issues are to be imported into. So the workaround will be to export the desired issues into CSV file using Issue Navigator and then import them back into another project using JIM.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}


*Original request description:*

I'm working on rolling out JIRA to a Big 10 University in the U.S. We anticipate the potential to have hundreds or possibly thousands of projects in our installation. One of the features we are keen on being able to offer our faculty is the ability to create a series of tasks organized into milestones (versions) such as phased assignments, research projects, etc. Ideally each instructor will be able to create task collections in a "master" course template, and clone out entire filter sets (including relevant issues and versions) to a collection of other projects belonging to their students. At the beginning of the course, the instructor could bulk copy these assignments and tasks out to each participant student's personal time management project, and they'd each have a unique copy of the tasks, organized into version milestones. Right now, I envision this will involve the following:
# The ability to create a project with tasks tied to given milestones. This functionality exists in the present version of JIRA (3.7.2)
# The ability to bulk copy (clone and move) an entire project milestone, including all relevant issues, to a list of projects. This feature does not presently exist.
# The possibility to deny the ability described in item 2 above to a specific list of users on the server.

I am willing to build this custom feature myself, but will need to purchase a source license first. However, the functionality might warrant a place in the default JIRA installation.

The advantage of being able to do this in a default installation of JIRA is that it would simplify multi-project installations for all Open Source communities.

EXAMPLE: all new projects need to perform basic project set-up chores (all administrivia you need to do to start an Open Source project, for example: 
* creating username on the appropriate servers, 
* setting up your ssh public keys, 
* mailing list tasks, 
* web site, 
* source repository publication, 
* adding developers and managing permissions, 
* producing unit tests, 
* documentation, 
* first release

All of these common tasks could be grouped into a "Getting Started" milestone that server admins could clone out to all new projects. We used to run into this problem at the CodeHaus all the time. The Apache software foundation also has a long list of things that all new projects must complete in order to become an official TLD. These tasks should be able to be auto-cloned wholesale to one or more existing projects from a master template.

I think having a case study on how to tie JIRA-based task management into the traditional academic enterprise would significantly increase the academic interest in this product. I saw some other issues out there that sort of batted this concept around, but nothing definitive or even that descriptive. I can't estimate how long this might take to implement, but welcome any suggestions or feedback from the JIRA development team.
fields.summary: Bulk Copy (clone+move) Issues to Multiple Projects

Hi
We are trying Jira to control all of activites in our software house. For this, we created a lot of kind of sub-tasks that represents our process like: analysis, software project, test project, development and so on. The problem that we are seeing is that there is no feature to filter and order some types of sub-tasks inside a task, and it´s dificult to visualize the information. In our context there are tasks that have more than 50 sub-tasks inside of lot of kinds of types. 
We suggest apply some type of filtering and ordering inside the tasks applied for sub-task associatedes.

Vinicius.
fields.summary: Filtering and ordering in subtasks table

fields.description:
JIRA has class SMTPMailServer that is used to send mail messages from queue. SMTP server can be configured to add prefix to subject of each message ("[JIRA]" for example).

We have own plugin that sends special mail messages (using standard MailQueue interface).

We need avoid addition of prefix ("[JIRA]") only in messages generated from that plugin. Seems like it is not possible.

I think SMTPMailServer should have additional method:

send(Email email, boolean usePrefix)

It should work like send(Email) when usePrefix is true, and should send message without prefix when usePrefix is false.
fields.summary: Send mail messages from plugin without prefix

fields.description:
Due to JRA-11999 we have added dependecy on oscache. We have worked hard to remove the dependency on oscache.

Justen has also done this in latest Crowd and changed it to use ehcache instead.

Therefore, we need to remove dependency on oscache and add dependency on ehcache 1.2.3.

See Justen for more info.
fields.summary: Update the caching library needed for crowd

fields.description:
JIRA 3.6 and above has the ability to grant a permission to a group custom field.

When one of these "Group Selector" permissions is granted in a scheme, that project becomes visible in portlets and in the "Browse" menu, even though no issues in it are visible. The project should only become visible to people in a group selected for visibility by at least one issue.
fields.summary: Adding group selector permission makes project name visible to everyone

fields.description: In JIRA 3.7.x we added a schema check to JIRA's startup. The schema check iterates over all the tables/columns in the database to see if the schema conforms to what we expect. This seems to take a long time on Oracle and can possibly take a long time in databases where there are a lot of tables present.
fields.summary: JIRA startup for 3.7.x is slow against some databases
When migrating workflows, don't prompt for mappings for unused issue types

fields.description:
In JIRA Professional, permissions can only be granted to groups, not individual users. I think we should remove this restriction because:
 - people can always create a group of 1 user, so it is more an annoyance than an actual limitation.
 - our [feature comparison|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/comparison.jsp] gives no hint of this restriction.
 - the JIRA Professional interface suggests that both groups and users can be granted permissions (see JRA-12041).
fields.summary: Allow Standard/Professional editions to grant permissions to individual users

fields.description:
A global administrator of jira cannot remove an user in the dialog "Assign Users to Project Role: Administrators", if he isn't an user in this project role himself.

You get the error: You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role.

But a global admin doesn't remove himself completely!
fields.summary: Cannot remove User from "Users in Project Role"

fields.description:
A lot of people don't realise that projects don't have a notification scheme associated with them by default, and that they must explicitly set this link up. People end up tinkering with unassociated schemes, wondering why they have no effect.

We could reduce this problem with a one-line indication of whether the scheme is used:

| !http://docs.ofbiz.org/images/icons/emoticons/lightbulb.gif! This scheme is currently *unused*.

| !http://docs.ofbiz.org/images/icons/emoticons/lightbulb_on.gif! This scheme is used by *1 project(s)*
fields.summary: Indicate when a scheme is in use

fields.description:
* go [here|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=12843]; you should see that the number of issues corresponding to this filter is approx. 3954
* in Issue navigator above, click the *Printable* link; the number of issues is still the same
* now click *Back to previous view* at the top; all of the sudden the number of displayed issues is approx. 25682 - the filter was lost

This issue is potentially very dangerous - the user does not notice the filter was reset to all issues and runs Bulk change on issues he though were filtered (hence changing all issues unintentionally)
fields.summary: Clicking Printable link in Issue Navigator then going back breaks the Filter

fields.description: There is currently no way to filter for issues that are in a specific status that are being worked on (eg. not unassigned).  This could easily be implemented as a NOT checkbox.  For example I wish to see all tasks that are open and not unassigned, or all tasks in a specific status that a specific developer is not working on.

fields.description:
While it is possible to attach a screen capture (using a Screenshot applet) or an Attachment to an Issue and comment on it, there's no apparent link between the comment and the respective attachment.
The screenshot/attachment and a comment should be grouped together OR the comment field should at least automatically link to a corresponding attachment.
fields.summary: Screen captures/Attachments and their comments should be "together"

fields.description:
I know this has been though the system several times, but its causes quite a bit of confusion.

Every other tool on the planet uses "Severity" where JIRA uses "Priority".
This is causing confusion between us and our customers as well as project planning (we can't actually add a "Priority" field now without adding more confusion.

Its pretty obvious that the word priority is well entrenched in the Jira code and database, but I think that something should be done about it sooner rather than later.

I am about to go and try renaming it by hacking JIRA as I've seen a few suggestions for, however I should have to.
fields.summary: Renaming 'Priority' to 'Severity'

fields.description:
I would be great to have capability of having effort of subtasks aggregated to the effort of the main task. 
Otherwise, there is quite hard to estimate the effort of a given task, you need all the time to sum up all numbers, that is ugly. You can monitor progress of finished tasks, but not the time required to finish them.

If that is already requested by another issue (JRA-11697), I apologize for making yet another one.
fields.summary: Aggregate effort of sub-tasks propageted to the main task

fields.description: There are some fields in the config which end with {{EXISTING_CUSTOM_FIELD}}, {{NEW_CUSTOM_FIELD}} and {{NEW_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE}}. The {{initiailiseUnmappedFields()}} method in 3.7.x should not take them into consideration.
fields.summary: CSV Importer - Unmapped Fields should not include new/existing CustomField

fields.description:
I attached a screenshot to an issue (see attached screenshot), and the familiar "Attach another screenshot" is missing!

However, when I added a screenshot to _this issue_ they *DID APPEAR*

Is it possible they are hidden if the user attaching is not also the reporter?
fields.summary: After attaching a screenshot, links to attach another are missing

fields.description:
To reproduce:

- login with Internet Explorer to your Jira Enterprise 3.7.2 application
- Go to an issue which as some sub tasks
- You will see a numeric list of sub tasks: 1. Some title; 2. Some Other title and so on.

With Firefox 2.0 or Konqueror 3.5.5 (I tested with these 2 browsers) I see that the number (in my example: "1." and around "2.") has a red background color if trhe issue is open. If the issue is closed/resolved: the number has a green color.

With Internet Explorer 6.0 and 7.0  there is no background color.

I've just upgraded from Jira 3.4.3 Enterprise. In version 3.4.3 Enterprise the background colors where shown correctly so I guess this CSS/HTML bug is present from a version newer than 3.4.3.
fields.summary: red or green color background around sub task number is missing/incompatible in Internet Explorer 6.0 and 7.0

fields.description:
Osworkflow allows to configure common-actions with no transition by setting the step attribute equal to "-1".  See the osworkflow [docs|http://wiki.opensymphony.com/display/WF/3.3+Common+and+Global+Actions] on this feature.  Currently the workfloweditor does not support actions that don't result in a transition.  The transition screen still displays an arrow pointing at an empty destination step.

However, the XML import of the workflow does not restrict the user from creating a workflow with step="-1". This results in exceptions thrown in log file when viewing the workflow in the editor, although the workflow will work.
fields.summary: Workflow editor needs to be able to handle step="-1" for common-actions

fields.description:
We are using one issue security scheme with one security level. The security level allows access via Group (jira-developers), Reporter and Group Selector (Customer ID).

Out of about 115 projects about 90 have associated this security scheme. All other projects have no security scheme associated.

If you configure the portlet "List ALL Filters" to your dashboard and have 35 filters it takes about 50 seconds to show that dashboard. Without that portlet it takes about 5 seconds.

Without issue security schemes and using the portlet "List ALL Filters" it takes about 3 seconds to show the dashboard.
fields.summary: Using issue security makes use of portal "List ALL Filters" very slow

fields.description:
The following JARs need to be included for Crowd to work:

{code}
commons-codec-1.3.jar
commons-collections-3.1.jar
commons-httpclient-3.0.jar
commons-logging-1.0.4.jar
jdom-1.0.jar
oscache-2.3.jar
stax-api-1.0.1.jar
wstx-asl-2.9.3.jar
xfire-all-1.2.1.jar
{code}

The user will only then need to copy over the Crowd jars for the version they have downloaded because we will be using the XFire libs. The most important one here is the {{commons-httpclient-3.0.jar}} must be version 3.0 or higher because of a library change after rc3.

Add the following files to the {{WEB-INF/classes}} folder:

crowd.properties:
{code}
application.name                        jira
application.password                    password
application.login.url                   http://localhost:8080/jira/

crowd.server.url                        http://localhost:8085/crowd/services/

session.isauthenticated                 session.isauthenticated
session.tokenkey                        session.tokenkey
session.validationinterval              0
session.lastvalidation                  session.lastvalidation
{code}

Change the osuser.xml to be like this:
{code:xml}
<!-- This is where JIRA's credentials checking can be configured.  For instance, see
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/ldap.html -->
<opensymphony-user>

	<authenticator class="com.opensymphony.user.authenticator.SmartAuthenticator" />

<!-- You will need to uncomment the Crowd providers below to enable Crowd integration -->
<!--
    <provider class="com.atlassian.crowd.integration.osuser.CrowdCredentialsProvider"/>
    <provider class="com.atlassian.crowd.integration.osuser.CrowdAccessProvider"/>
    <provider class="com.atlassian.crowd.integration.osuser.CrowdProfileProvider"/>
-->

<!-- CROWD:START  -- The providers below here will need to be commented out for Crowd integration -->
	<provider class="com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.osuser.CoreOFBizCredentialsProvider">
		<property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
	</provider>

	<provider class="com.opensymphony.user.provider.ofbiz.OFBizProfileProvider">
		<property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
	</provider>

	<provider class="com.opensymphony.user.provider.ofbiz.OFBizAccessProvider">
		<property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
	</provider>

<!-- CROWD:END -->

</opensymphony-user>
{code}

Add the following propertyset provider to the {{properset.xml}} file:

{code:xml}
<propertyset name="crowd" class="com.atlassian.crowd.integration.osuser.CrowdPropertySet"/>
{code}
fields.summary: Add XFire (Crowd) dependency libraries and adjust configuration file to have stubbed out Crowd configurations.

fields.description:
With Jeff Turner's help, we've started attacking the spam that is afflicting Codehaus's JIRA instance.

Initially using: http://jira.codehaus.org/secure/admin/cleancommentspam.jsp

There are a few things that slow us down:

1) I can generally tell whether it's going to be a spam comment in the first 10 lines, being able to just grab the first 10 lines of each spam would let you fit more on the screen.
    Perhaps a checkbox for full spam / vs. a precis of the start
2) No easy way to nuke a user that is spamming - this stems from the user name not matching the email and being unable to search on username in the User admin area.  Making the user have both a link 
 * to their profile (administration of user is most useful screen)
 * to do a search for all comments by this user 
 in the spam comment list would resolve this nicely.  i.e. open two new tabs, one to get rid of the user, one to get rid of the comments.

3) Delete all - once I've identified a spammer, I search on their user name, and then select all of their comments for deletion - a select all button would be handy (tab / space / tab / space is quick, but select all would also be handy). Alternatively - a select all button.

4) No way to search for anonymous comments - this is almost inconsequential - the only reason we have anonymous comments is due to misconfiguration of our permission schemes. Hopefully the new roles based schemes will remove this problem.
fields.summary: Possible improvements to JIRA for spam fighting

When I enter a time span for the "Filterabonnement" in days (according to the "Examples," the abbreviation for this would be "t"), I always receive an error message saying that I must enter a valid time period.  The problem is that it only works with "d" (for the English "days").

fields.description:
When configuring a CreateOrCommentHandler, or any handler for that matter, you will get an NPE if you don't specify any parameters at all. It looks like this:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.init(AbstractMessageHandler.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler.init(CreateIssueHandler.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
{noformat}

This is because in AbstractMessageHandlingService line 42, the params map does not get set on the handler if there is no param. We should instead at least init the params to an empty map. We should probably alert the user on the input screen that they need some parameters.
fields.summary: When adding a createOrComment mail handler with no params you get a NPE when the handler tries to handle the mail

fields.description:
If JIRA is setup with an old license key through the setup wizard, after the final step it displays an error message stating it is old (which is fine) but the page has a duplicate header (duplicate decorator applied). This duplicate header disappears when the error page automatically disappears.

The cause of this is because the setup wizard does not redirect to the error page - leaving the /secure/Setup3.jspa url - which matches an entry in the decorators.xml and is applied the duplicate header. Once the error page automatically refreshes the error page, the url is set to the error page which was defined to be excluded from decoration
fields.summary: Jira has duplicate header if setup with old license

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11987].
  {panel}

Users who download the ZIP version on Unix, Linux or Mac cannot run JIRA due to the following startup error:

If you encounter issues starting up JIRA Standalone Edition, please see the Troubleshooting guide at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installation+Troubleshooting+Guide 
The BASEDIR environment variable is not defined correctly 
This environment variable is needed to run this program 

The error occurs when the setclasspath.sh file isn't executable because the user used the zip distribution instead of the tar.gz.

To avoid this, we should fix our zip distribution so it sets the executable bit.
fields.summary: Executable bit not set on shell scripts in zip distribution

fields.description:
Hmmm...I've got some bad news to report... looks like a *big fat bug* in issueType migration.

I am moving a project from an IssueTypeScheme to a new IssueTypeScheme which has fewer types. So therefore I need to migrate type.

I looked closely this morning at my selections in the migrate issues screen for a project. 
There were *three issue types* that were migrating... but the "summary screen" was incorrect.

I selected this:
Action Item --> Task
Enhancement --> Improvement
Requirement --> New Feature

I verified and checked this TWICE!

The verification summary had the list reversed:
Action Item --> New Feature
Enhancement --> Improvement
Requirement --> Task

It was a small project, with only 9 issue, so I did a screengrab before...and then hit "Finish" to migrate, thinking maybe the summary display was incorrect, but it would Do the Right Thing. No such luck.

The "after" screenshot did exactly what the summary said it would do...which is NOT what I wanted to happen. I had to manually fix the issues. :-(

Is this a known bug in Jira 3.6.5???

Tim
fields.summary: IssueType migration is incorrectly REVERSED!
Better number handling/tokenization

fields.description:
1. For every project we have issues opened in-house by our development team during the production and testing process
called "Issues" and we have our customers opening issues for the same Project for the modules that are already in Production which are called Incidents. The customers do not have access to our internal issues. With our current defect tracking system, we have the ability to separate the two per project. But now we are stumped and consider this a Show-stopper as we will either have to have 2 different Projects - one for the customers and one for Internal use. We consdider this a lot of hassle and duplication of effort.
2. The issues and Incidents need to have separate Key to differentiate them.
fields.summary: Ability to associate two issue types with one project & need different prefix for both types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11970].
  {panel}

As a security measure we do not want to allow more than 2 concurrent logins for any Jira user.
Unfortunately, this feature is not available in JIRA 3.7.1 Enterprise. 
I will strongly recommend including this in your future release.

Please refer to support issue # JSP-9605

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11966].
  {panel}

In a restrictive project users generally might not have the permission to assign issues to other participants,
except via workflows and only if this coincidates with a status change (this is what is required by my project,
an assignment where a status change is involved at the same time). 

Withdrawing the "assign" permission will let the assign-option disappear from the "action" menu (which is good) 
but also entails that users can no longer be picked from e.g. the Standard Workflow Screen, since this is not permitted 
to the current user. It seems to me that workflow transitions will be executed in the security context of the presently logged  
in user.

Is there an issue/solution I missed?

THX,
Klaus

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11953].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When sending an email, it is always nice to be able to see who received it (by looking at the To: Cc: Bcc:)

JIRA is sending out email notifications all the time but it is not possible to see who received them. Notification schemes and workflows can change at anytime but there is no way to look back in the history of a bug to see who got notified and when.

I guess you could only see everything in context when you click on "All" because "Comments" and "Change History" both result in an email notification.

Just an example of why this would be useful - in our company, we use JIRA like an information tool. Sometimes whilst commenting on an issue, we like to "copy" a few people so that they see the comment. It would be great to have this logged so we can see who actually received a notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
Within an issue, you can see "All", "Comments", "Work Log", "Change History" and "Version Control". Would it be possible to add a new one called "Notifications"? 

h3. Workaround
Use a third-party plugin which already have this feature; [Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui/cloud/overview]. Please refer to [Enable the Notification History Issue Tab|https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JEMH/Enable+the+Notification+History+Issue+Tab] for more information.
fields.summary: Show notification history within an issue

I've designed some new issue types, screens, screen schemes, workflows... for special purposes. It works :) 

So I got a special kind of create issue screen now. The screen validation fails because the "summary field" isn't fullfilled. Unfortunally, this screen is configured to contain no summary field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11951].
  {panel}

Hi,

I am not sure whether this feature has already been requested. If yes, could you point me to the appropriate documentation.

Is it possible for Jira to send automatic notification when a particular open issue has been inactive for a while... i.e. no comments, no work on the issue being done. For e.g. If the issue has been inactive for.. say 2 weeks (customisable) or so... an email notification is to be sent to the Assignee/Reporter that no activity has been occured for the past 2 weeks.

I am happy to give more details on this.

Thanks,

Vijesh

 (Errcode: 13)
